content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    lines = ""
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(str)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            lines *= (current_line == "" ? "" : "\n") * current_line
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    if current_line != ""
        lines *= current_line
    end
    return lines
end

# Example usage:
str = "Hello there this is a very long sentence that should wrap to multiple lines after each word exceeding the text width of 10 characters"
println(wrap_string(str))
```
